title: Ticket #4549: "condor_qsub -l mem=2048MB" doesn't work.
description:
(Quoted from htcondor-admin #27263:

I think I found a very small bug in condor 8.2.2 (using the el6 x86_64 rpms). Line 841 of condor_qsub reads mem_value="echo $mem_value | tr a-z A-Z" which produces the error: 

$ condor_qsub -l mem=2048MB `pwd`/burn.sh

ERROR: Parse error in expression:
	RequestMemory = echo 2048MB | tr a-z A-Z
	^^^
Error in submit file
Job submission failed.
If one changes the line in condor_qsub to mem_value=`echo $mem_value | tr a-z A-Z`, all works as expected.
remarks:
2014-Aug-22 15:42:30 by adesmet:
I agree with the user's fix and have applied it.

2014-Aug-22 16:37:53 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: This change on line 841 looks good. However, shouldn't it also be applied to line 830: 
 file_value="echo $file_value | tr a-z A-Z" #Uppercase

2014-Sep-22 13:32:45 by adesmet:
This particular report is fixed. New bug opened as Ticket #4606: file option in condor_qsub probably broken.
check_ins:

2014-Aug-22 15:40   Check-in [41021]: Fix "-l mem" option to condor_qsub. #4549 (By Alan De Smet )
creator: adesmet
